entry.fullTitle: Azur Lane Guides: Suchiguma, Who Am I [Home]

text.text: I Suchiguma you may call me sushi or sushigummy if that s easier am the main author of this website which contains several guides and resources for Azur Lane endgame I specialize in crafting fleet gear strategy for endgame PvE battles These are some examples of my achievements EX Usually top 3 EX score across EN servers Extreme Challenge Auto speedruns with the world s fastest or near fastest clear times in multiple months Hard Arbiter Auto speedruns like killing each arbiter in 21 seconds using faster but lower damage gear Campaign Auto lethal 15 4 with a single fleet no subs no support carriers no crossfleet Go back to the Home Page view my work

entry.fullTitle: Azur Lane Guides: Suchiguma, My Story [Home]

text.text: A long long time ago but after EN servers beta period I was a clueless little new player I found some deteriorating and in hindsight often questionable guides on the street and perused them diligently along with the EN wiki helping me clear Chapter 12 with ease However as a casual player I fell victim to mistakes such as retiring ships after level 70 MLB for the noble but misguided ideal of clearing dock space some of the ships lost in the great purges offered key level 120 tech stats sorry Intrepid and Eskimo Sometime in late 2020 I began taking the game more seriously I farmed 12 2 and 12 4 with a 1 3 fleet and even wrote a simulation to calculate when to retreat from 12 4 for maximum ship experience gains this was before clearing rewards were added for completing the boss battle However mobilizing my account to handle the endgame content of the time proved slow and I failed to one shot Hiryuu META and Ark Royal META when Operation Siren released Fast forward a few years and it seems I ve made rather respectable progress despite my dubious beginnings Today Im hailed as one of the most eminent scholars of my field My journey proves that I I forgot the point of writing this story

entry.fullTitle: Azur Lane Guides: Contact, [Home]

text.text: I hang out in the Azur Lane Official Discord If you have a general gameplay question that can be formulated outside the context of this website then ask in the #gameplay help channel there You may or may not ping me If your gameplay question must mention some content in this website then either ask in the #gameplay help channel there but do NOT ping me or direct message me @suchiguma Note that I will not accept low effort or easy questions in DMs My DMs are reserved for feedback or complex important questions about my guides or content that you do not trust #gameplay help with Please also direct fleet building help or dock account help to #gameplay help

entry.fullTitle: Azur Lane Guides: Chapter 15, Map Walkthrough [Guides]

text.text: This guide is for first time clearing Chapter 15 on auto in lethal threat level with manual enemy node selection Auto search on safe threat for farming Houston II is not covered maybe just take 15 4 Option A and add a healer to the boss fleet If you have reached Chapter 15 we assume you know basic fleet building fleet positioning and basic game terminology like BB AA and ASW Read wiki notes for mechanics Read the Allied Support Carriers point very carefully A message about requirements 15 1 and 15 2 Same as in Chapter 14 X 1 and X 2 form the tutorial and X 3 and X 4 are much harder The enemy order here is six mobs one boss The 15 1 boss has medium armor and the 15 2 boss has heavy armor Both your mob and boss fleets need to contain decent ships and gear There is nothing notable about 15 1 as its a tutorial to Chapter 15 The boss in 15 2 is a double BBV boss Ise and Hyuuga Their shelling can delete a full HP main fleet ship in the span of three seconds Putting a washing machine and EVA augment Scepter or Officer s Sword on your main fleet ships especially the flagship is strongly recommended for 15 2 only Be prepared to quit the battle and retry Summon submarines just before the bosses spawn so they can help delete the bosses quicker If you choose to manual use airstrikes to cancel the bosses salvos 15 3 Enemy submarines appear in Reconnaissance Fleets DD nodes in 15 3 and 15 4 Your mob fleet must bring ASW Technically you could fight BB nodes and CV nodes only but thats just simply harder The enemy order in 15 3 is three mobs medium armor first boss two mobs medium armor second boss The same boss fleet you used for 15 1 and 15 2 should be able to handle the second boss But now your mob fleet has to deal with submarines and a tough first boss Strongly consider shifting some better gear and or ships to the mob fleet if your boss fleet is not struggling 15 4 The enemy order in 15 4 is three mobs medium armor first boss two mobs light armor second boss one mob light medium armor third boss Option A A very strong boss fleet fights the first and third bosses Try to not spend more than 25% of any ships HP in the first boss battle Using a healer with good damage like Volga is reasonable but damage is still important The mob fleet can be about as strong as the 15 3 mob fleet You have access to an ammo node and the second boss is a pushover and acts as free healing if you are using two healers The only harder parts compared to 15 3 are that enemies are one level higher and that there are two Special Aviation Fleets Option B A very strong mob fleet fights all mobs first boss and third boss Tip This very strong mob fleet should contain at least two of Guam Laffey II Eldridge Retrofit San Diego Retrofit and Shimanto Since the boss fleet is only dealing with an easy second boss you can add crossfleet ships to help the mob fleet The boss fleet can look like UR BB Independence Perseus tank flex flex Option B is also the most consistent strategy to defeat all mobs to get the third star Option B third star To get the third star we recommend this order Do NOT use the ammo node early Fight two Special Aviation Fleets Fight one more enemy We want to prioritize Large Main Fleets while the mob fleet still has ammo If there are none choose a Large Air Formation or whatever is hardest Fight Boss 1 and then one more enemy following the same order as in Step 2 Now the mob fleet is out of ammo Choose a hard enemy if your fleet is healthy otherwise choose an easy enemy Use the boss fleet for Boss 2 Reserve two Medium or Large Reconnaissance fleets and Boss 3 until the end Use your mob fleet to fight everything else Pick up the full 3 ammo node clear the last two Reconnaissance fleets to hopefully heal up and clear Boss 3 Recommendation If you can t three star on lethal then don t Safe threat level gives your fleet like 20% damage dealt and 36% damage taken

entry.fullTitle: Azur Lane Guides: Chapter 15, General Fleet Structure [Guides]

text.text: Mob Boss Fleet Mob fleet UR BB 2 healer CV CVLs tank flex flex Boss fleet UR BB 2 damage CV CVLs tank flex flex The flex slots should not be squishy and should contribute survivability AA and or damage Add ASW in the 15 3 15 4 mob fleet Good ships can contribute two or three or even four of these For the boss fleet damage carriers you may use a semi preload like Independence or Impero to deal with the pre boss waves quicker These two also have strong damage for the boss anyways If you use two normal reload carriers then try to desync them Support Carrier Fleet Carrier level AVI and RLD matter Affinity affects AVI and RLD You should get all support carriers to at least level 120 and Love affinity because Chapter 15 is not the place to be cutting corners at The equipped fighter and the fighter enhancement level matter The DB or TB can be any enhancement level and any plane just have gold or rainbow for 45 or 65 avi stat Assuming all have equal level affinity and gear etc the best support fleet carriers are in slightly decreasing order of strength Fritz Rumey much stronger Nakhimov REQUIRES DEV 30 Indomitable Implacable Illustrious Illustrious Chen Hai Retrofit Little Illustrious Langley Retrofit Yorktown II Independence Albion Centaur Slightly means slightly it s ok to use a more accessible ship lower on the list The best support fighter is Flapjack followed by the much cheaper and still effective Skyrocket and fw190a5 All three of these are in Gear Lab If you are on a budget prioritize Flapjacks for the surface fleets and fill the support fleet with Skyrocket or fw190a5 Submarine Fleet They are all similar pick any three SR subs Many bonus points for high oxygen some bonus points for fleet synergy Use Improved Snorkel on everyone Use any mix of Bidder G7e or Type 95 Kai or use six of the same it doesnt matter Example submarine setup Example submarine setup Submarines should be used on all boss battles but optional for 15 4s second boss so reserve ammo for those Spend the other ammo on out of ammo battles or the Special Aviation Fleet Avoid summoning submarines at the beginning of a battle Summoning submarines early in battle means that they surface and die Summon them 20 to 40 seconds into the battle so that you win before they run out of oxygen You know roughly how long your battles take

entry.fullTitle: Azur Lane Guides: Chapter 15, Gear Notes [Guides]

text.text: If you havent been playing Operation Siren you probably wont win in Chapter 15 Lots of the best gear is in Gear Lab and 13 gear is a huge boost in strength Bring Hedgehog and at least one other ASW weapon on the mob fleet for 15 3 and 15 4 Options include a gold ASW plane or purple ASW plane on a CVL a purple depth charge or Eldridge Retrofit Mob fleet BB wants 457mm Twin 410 kai for Musashi Boss fleet BB can use another 457mm or a 20s triple gun like champ gun For BB aux guns Quad 152 > 137mm > Triple 155mm Felix gun gold Twin 150 > Triple 155mm Kai Mob and boss fleet fighters Flapjack > Tigercat corsair pirate squad Torpedo bombers Wyvern > Spearfish > Breguet > poverty AA guns STAAG for main fleet Sextuple for the strongest AA gun slot some mix of Twin 57mm Twin 90mm Sextuple or Twin 113mm for the rest Obviously the more rainbow 57mm the better Auxes standard auxes but vanguard ships especially if the middle slot is not a DD can use anti torpedo bulges if they are not occupied with ASW

entry.fullTitle: Azur Lane Guides: Chapter 15, Misc. Recommendations [Guides]

text.text: Use cats they do not have to be perfect Random level 30 cats boost your fleet by 10 20% Important talents mountain on mob flame when out of ammo > flame when with ammo mountain on boss > other stuff Use double line or circular formation never single line depending on how good your fleets AA is Kill the enemy Special Aviation Fleet at the beginning of each sortie Avoid Large Medium Main Fleets If you re 3 starring use Shimanto and or Musashi and never fight them when out of ammo Check the tier list on the home page for what ships are good and sort by Chapter 15 Mob Boss Or this Chapter 15 specific tier list for a quick overview of ships by role but it s not updated since November 2024

entry.fullTitle: Azur Lane Guides: Chapter 15, Example Fleets [Guides]

text.text: The part you ve been waiting for or skipped to Please don t complain if you copy these and lose because you didn t read the above instructions or don t know how to choose better gear or ships https renhex github io alft 211 typical fleets for 15 1 15 3 or 15 4 Option A Add your better gear or ships Add washing machines for 15 2 https renhex github io alft 212 a top mob fleet for 15 4 Option B Do not use such a weak boss fleet on other maps Also can act as 3 starring fleets that may or may not work on lethal depending on whether your account is actually good Tip Fleet screenshots using Azur Lane Fleet Tool show the vanguard from bottom main tank to top off tank It s like the in game Formation screen but rotated counter clockwise The ships are also marked with 1 2 and 3 from bottom to top Correct vanguard order

entry.fullTitle: Azur Lane Guides: Augment Modules, Introduction [Guides]

text.text: The cores and experience stones needed to craft and upgrade unique augments are time gated Currently it is impossible to have crafted and maxed all unique augments released in the game Meta chasing and new players need to choose carefully which ships to craft augments for Thus this augment module tier list was made to rate the effectiveness and worth of each augment to help you make those decisions Expand to see the rubric. Gain Gain for unique augments rates the overall benefit the augment brings to the ship over a generic purple augment (or no augment, for ships who can't use purple augments). This includes damage, survivability, buffing, and everything. The relative strength of the ship does not matter; a +50% damage boost for a weak ship should be rated the same as a +50% damage boost for a strong ship. Worth Worth is subjective. If you must use a waifu no matter what, then of course her augment would be very much worth. So the "worth" ratings in the table roughly follows this rubric: Has sizeable gain for a ship who sees various endgame use. Has sizeable gain for a ship who is good in at least some endgame content and has few other substitutes. Makes the ship useful for midgame to lategame. Makes the ship decent but not meta. Worse than or equal to purple augments, or the augmented ship would still be bad. New SKK Rates "worth" for new players, covering your first two or three unique augments or until you reach "midgame" (farming Chapter 12 or beating Abyssal zones). Obviously, do not craft the unique augment of a ship you don't own.... This tier list should not force you to obtain a ship. The most important in helping a new player reach midgame. Very helpful for a new player to reach midgame. Good to have as a new player but maybe a bit out of order. Diverts resources away from far more important augments or outlives its usefulness quickly. Simply a waste of augment resources for a new player. Collabs Collab augments are cheaper to max level, and this cheapness is included in both "worth" ratings for all players and for new players. If an old collab augment is said to be worth for new players, obviously new new players can't get them (or the ships) anymore. So it is just there for new players who got the ship and augment, then quit the game and recently returned.

entry.fullTitle: Azur Lane Guides: Augment Modules, Purple Augments [Guides]

text.text: Note New players should save up for impactful unique augments instead of crafting or upgrading blue purple augments

entry.fullTitle: Azur Lane Guides: Challenge Mode, Introduction [Challenge Mode]

text.text: Each month s page will have strategies and several example fleets Although we try to be detailed in strategies and provide multiple example fleets we do not know what ships or gear you have Treat the example fleets as examples and consider your own better upgrades or close substitutes Warning Do not treat examples as requirements New Jersey s presence in an example fleet is not an endorsement for using UR bulins on her We assume Hard Augur difficulty but the same strategies usually work for lower difficulties with worse fleets and gear We also assume auto battle only because most of the difficult CM gimmicks are nullified by proper manualing Always check boss stats and skills on Extreme Challenge wiki or in game but sometimes the game says a wrong number Tip Fleet screenshots using Azur Lane Fleet Tool show the vanguard from bottom main tank to top off tank It s like the in game Formation screen but rotated counter clockwise The ships are also marked with 1 2 and 3 from bottom to top Correct vanguard order

entry.fullTitle: Azur Lane Guides: Challenge Mode, Timing [Challenge Mode]

text.text: Most CM s are exercises in reading and timing Oaths or exact gear levels 10 to 13 are not required unless for timing However many example fleets are timing sensitive and you often won t have the exact ships oaths gear cat RLD and RLD tech to copy them correctly Then you will need to calculate your own fleet timing To the best of our knowledge this online calculator henceforth referred to as the calculator is the only one that is precise enough for these CM timing calculations We highly recommend not being scared by it and learning how to use it on desktop If an example fleet requires 50 CV RLD with oath that means you need oathed CVs and have CV reload from tech cats 50 Alternatively it would also probably work without oaths and with CV tech cats 57 or 58 Due to how the game code loop works some boss skills boss movement patterns or ship skills can be delayed by 0 0s to 0 1s every time This is more noticeable in long battles like the game mode this guide is for Some strategies attempt to account for this delay but sometimes it can t be fixed

entry.fullTitle: Azur Lane Guides: January Challenge, Strategy [Challenge Mode]

text.text: read the wiki Timing precision Easy DPS check Hard Tank check Easy This month is a straight DPS and reading check Light status shielded healing 1% HP per second Dark status easy mode Bring vanguard ships that spam a lot of shells to break the shield as fast as possible because you do not want to let Katsuragi heal 15% HP for every 30% lost Other than the vanguard shell spam there are no other gimmicks so bring typical good anti medium DPS We only provide examples of fleets with good synergy and sync to attain high DPS If you do not know how to set up high DPS fleets in the absence of boss gimmicks by yourself we recommend asking or lurking in ALO Discord #gameplay help Note Katsuragi s movement cycle is approximately 28 45s long so you should bring your own slow freeze Although Katsuragi s skill descriptions imply that the five rotating shields can each block 70 shells in reality they share the same hit count So if 70 shells each hit any of the shields all five shields disappear and Katsuragi enters Dark status Furthermore like typical rotating shields her shields will not block arcing shells from BB guns CB guns torpedos and bombs Katsuragi also often moves back to the far right of the screen as 13 4 Taihou does when carpet bombing Taking this information into consideration some example favored and unfavored things are listed here Things that are good against Katsuragi Twin 138 6mm and both Twin 130mm s have high range and shells per second Twin 100mm Kai has high shells per second and spams barrages but is more inconsistent due to low range Plymouth has 3 main gun mounts MGMs and a guaranteed aimed barrage every 10s San Diego and Scylla spam shells and have good AA to keep carriers concealed though Sandy s augment barrage ignores shields Helena has 2 CL MGMs and 1 DD mount Barrage or MGM spammers like Mogador Harbin or Tashkent s Things that may be good in general but are less so against Katsuragi Triple 155mm Kai or any other slow gun CA guns have low shells per second CBs and basically all CAs have poor shield breaking capabilities and their tankiness is not needed Hindenburg s guns ignore shields Z52 s barrages pass through shields and she only has 1 MGM Tempesta submarine frigates can also help break one shield cycle Summon them a few seconds before you will pass the 30% HP difference since Katsuragi last had shields Just put cheap gear no need to spend core data on all the 12 pounders and Round Shots Tempesta example fleet

entry.fullTitle: Azur Lane Guides: January Challenge, Mid-End CV [Challenge Mode]

text.text: A fleet like this should win in under 10 minutes with half tech and mid cats Fritz is not using double BF109G because that would make her too fast To keep Fritz before AvP do not exceed 50 CV RLD Enterprise will desync eventually but not much we can do about it Scylla has been unavailable for a while now so pick a substitute from above if you don t have her Since Scylla s torpedos are too hard to sync for 10 minutes we opt for the fastest torps to spam more barrage Mid End CV example fleet

entry.fullTitle: Azur Lane Guides: January Challenge, Mid-End BB [Challenge Mode]

text.text: None Even the High End BB fleet will take over 6 minutes with half tech and mid cats

entry.fullTitle: Azur Lane Guides: January Challenge, High-End CV [Challenge Mode]

text.text: Should clear in 4 to 6 minutes with high tech bad cats and no subs For this specific gear and oaths Nakhimov syncs with Soyuz at 56 CV RLD and 17 BB RLD or subtract an equal amount of RLD from both CVs and BBs Don t forget to decrease your CV tech to use cats with CV RLD Flandre gun was chosen to keep Helena sync You may also use Champagne gun with 45 CV RLD and 17 BB RLD Calculator Link High End CV example fleet

entry.fullTitle: Azur Lane Guides: January Challenge, High-End BB [Challenge Mode]

text.text: There s not much else to explain at this point As usual for CM block Bismarck behind Soyuz and or Alsace so that they stay synced High End BB example fleet

entry.fullTitle: Azur Lane Guides: November Challenge, Strategy [Challenge Mode]

text.text: read the wiki Timing precision Hard DPS check Medium Tank check Hard This is a CM that can be very annoying due to various sources of lag and RNG However do not be scared by the double Hard If you time Unicorn precisely then the Tank check is naturally solved Or if you bring tanks and Perseus then Perseus trivializes the timing precision You must either bring a vanguard heal that activates every 20s or have carriers that reload slightly faster than 20s for a screen clear Toolkits alone will not do the job The best ways to get the heal are Primary Healers Recommended Unicorn who has the benefit of doing more damage and healing than Perseus Must be timed properly 19 92s 19 93s probably works for 5 7 minutes and 19 94s 19 96s probably works for 10 minutes For a level 125 Unicorn in love BF 109G and Ryuusei is 19 95s in game with 2 RLD tech also try 3 RLD if 2 doesn t work or use HVARcat and Ju 87d with 0 RLD tech Do not bring cats with CVL RLD Passing the first few stings relies on RNG because if your vanguard is too close to the boss then they ll get hit before Unicorn heals Perseus who suffers from low damage and lower healing She struggles to keep a sandwiched Aurora alive so Eldridge is needed A Plymouth Aurora Eldridge vanguard can survive for 7 minutes which may not be enough time if your main fleet is weak Furthermore if her heal lags less than Elbing s sting then Perseus can cleanse your vanguard of venom right before Scorpion s Mist which lasts for 2s expires If your ships are moving they regain the venom by touching Scorpion s Mist Minor Healers not recommended due to how much damage the boss does Little Formidable requires >90% HP so to avoid her being burnt bring at least one non concealed main fleet ship or pray with a full carrier fleet Marseillaise for a full French vanguard Boise with a level 8 healing skill Ognevoy has a 10s heal but she desyncs after like 5 minutes due to activating 4x as much as Elbing s skill Due to a possible bug similarly to Cancer Graf Spee most vanguard ships get the 60% damage buff permanently even if they get healed Ships who gain lose or refresh another source of damageRatioBullet like Bayard or Bremerton lose the free 60% damage until the next venom mist Also damage may be tight so GLHF if you don t have Aurora Time graph for skills

entry.fullTitle: Azur Lane Guides: November Challenge, Mid-End BB [Challenge Mode]

text.text: This fleet and gear won in 7 25 using half tech a random gold purple submarine fleet with random torps and no synergy and the free cats level 30 Drake and level 25 Every Mid End BB example fleet

entry.fullTitle: Azur Lane Guides: November Challenge, High-End BB 1 [Challenge Mode]

text.text: Any oaths or tech just keep the faster black white shell BB blocked behind the slower BB who is using AFCT HSFCR High End BB example fleet 1

entry.fullTitle: Azur Lane Guides: November Challenge, High-End BB 2 [Challenge Mode]

text.text: Same explanation as High End BB 1 But with Ognevoy instead of Unicorn the fleet has to win faster due to Ognevoy s sync drift and the lack of healing High End BB example fleet 2

entry.fullTitle: Azur Lane Guides: November Challenge, French [Challenge Mode]

text.text: Again any oaths or tech just keep the faster black white shell BBs blocked behind the slower BB with AFCT HSFCR Removing Aurora and Plymouth is a big loss in DPS but the extra BB may recover some of it Marseillaise is required because she heals French ships every 20s Elbing does a lot of damage so Brest is required if your battle will go longer than 5 minutes The third ship can be Le Mars for fleet buff Mogador for damage or L Audacieux for worse Mogador French example fleet

entry.fullTitle: Azur Lane Guides: November Challenge, Mid-End CV [Challenge Mode]

text.text: For the super lazy people who don t want to time Unicorn you can use Unicorn and Perseus together This fleet won in 9 49 with no subs half tech a single cat without flame and no HVARcat or Skyraider Mid End CV example fleet

entry.fullTitle: Azur Lane Guides: November Challenge, Very High-End CV [Challenge Mode]

text.text: Forgo healing and use CV screenclear to wipe the sting barrage This requires carriers to be slightly faster than 20s which is a high bar for CVs but not CVLs like Unicorn Due to the 1 5s start of battle delay if your faster CV has exactly 20 0s reload the screen clear will happen 0 5s after the boss fires the true damage barrage If your vanguard is too close to the boss due to RNG then they ll die in that 0 5s So you want CVs to reload slightly faster than 20s but not so fast that the CVs strike before the barrage appears Or just be a normal person and use the other fleets

entry.fullTitle: Azur Lane Guides: December Challenge, Strategy [Challenge Mode]

text.text: read the wiki Timing precision Medium DPS check Medium Tank check Hard First read the boss skills if you haven t You must consistently interrupt Warspite every 20s and not mentioned is that her charge attack has 30k HP and finishes in 5s Let success denote your fleet successfully interrupting Warspite by dealing enough damage Let failure denote the opposite Generally a success causes your main fleet to lose a little HP and a failure causes it to lose a LOT of HP Do not expect to tank two or more failures On average the charge attack happens every ~20 05s and Warspite stops for ~8 2s shown in the chart below every ~20 45s Strategies that attempt to take advantage of her stop should consider that timing attacks to her charge attack will become desynced with her stop later in the battle One recurring strategy you will find in the following fleets is a BB excluding Alsace or Unzen with 20s reload time After one failure Warspite will blind your fleet preventing torpedos airstrikes and main fleet salvos from launching The blindness ends around the same time Warspite begins the next charge Since BBs and Unzen cannot begin reloading the next attack while holding one they will become synced with Warspite s charging for the rest of the battle Time graph for skills

entry.fullTitle: Azur Lane Guides: December Challenge, Mid-End [Challenge Mode]

text.text: Unfortunately this CM is hard Try your best to copy one of the High End fleets with Helena and manual for clearing barrages or hitting stop times if you need to

entry.fullTitle: Azur Lane Guides: December Challenge, YOLO: High-End BB [Challenge Mode]

text.text: The least effort strategy that may randomly lose even when geared well The BBs have no sync whatsoever so they fire at arbitrary times with UvH offering frequent salvos Every 20s pray that at least one BB s salvo partially falls within the 5s charge attack window and some high DPS vanguard ships can also help reach the 30k threshold The fleet is expected to get a few interrupt failures so you should also pray that your BBs evade enough shells In fleets with non concealed ship s Warspite will fire additional AP barrages at your main fleet ships especially Musashi or the flagship These barrages chip away your BBs HP so it is a DPS race If you don t have three good vanguard ships like Eldridge Aegir Plymouth Unzen Hindenburg Guam or Helena then you could try putting a ship with Flank Defense or Flagship Cover If you put in more effort you can try to get Unzen s torpedos or one of the BBs to have around 20s reload time Then the fleet will win more consistently High End BB example fleet

entry.fullTitle: Azur Lane Guides: December Challenge, High-End CV [Challenge Mode]

text.text: Because carriers except Impero can store airstrikes being blinded once by Warspite will not sync the 20s carriers to the charge attack Therefore these fleets must rely on the vanguard to deal 30k damage in 5s If you can get the vanguard damage to work then ~20s CVs with Helena should produce the fastest possible clear times Warning Unzen s 20 0s to 20 1s improved quad mag torpedos are all but required Shown here is an unoathed Unzen with 10 CA RLD tech and a 4 Autoloader yielding a faster reload than 20 0s but Unzen can be lagged or blocked so 19 98s is suitable Ideally you should find a sync with one or two oxytorps instead of autoloader The example could have put two oxytorps but the autoloader toolkit was chosen for people who win slower Shinano being the slowest of the three carriers takes defensive auxes to survive for over 5 minutes High End CV example fleet This is a 2023 video using Hakuryuu instead of Amagi CV but the idea is identical An alternate version with Admiral Nakhimov but requries very high CV RLD and damage Since there is no other Northern Parliament slow we need Royal Fortune to provide slow as well Because of the high CV reload tech after Royal Fortune leaves the CVs have caught up to Warspite s stop times
